proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: C on BD, ∠CBF, ∠FAE, CD, ∠FDB, Arc(BFE), ∠AED, 3.14 = pi, ∠BAF, ∠EAB, EF, ∠FED, ∠EDB, BC, ∠DBF, E on ⊙(F, radius_F), CE, BF, ∠ABD, ∠CAB, ∠EFB, A on ⊙(F, radius_F), Arc(EFB), ∠EFB, DF, pi * (68 / 180) = Arc(EFB), ∠FBA, D on ⊙(F, radius_F), ∠AEF, ∠FAC, ∠DEA, C on AE, ∠EFA, ∠DFE, DE, ∠AED, AB, BD, ∠BFA, AF, AE, ∠ACB, ∠ABC, AC, B on ⊙(F, radius_F), ∠AFD

Step 2:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on BD, ∠FDB
Conclusions: ∠FDB = ∠FDC

Step 3:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(BFE)
Conclusions: ∠BFE = Arc(BFE)

Step 4:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠BAF, ∠FAE, ∠EAB
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠BAF + ∠EAB + ∠FAE

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on BD, ∠EDB
Conclusions: ∠EDB = ∠EDC

Step 6:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on BD, ∠DBF
Conclusions: ∠CBF = ∠DBF

Step 7:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : E on ⊙(F, radius_F)
Conclusions: radius_F = EF

Step 8:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠ABD, C on BD
Conclusions: ∠ABC = ∠ABD

Step 9:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : A on ⊙(F, radius_F)
Conclusions: radius_F = AF

Step 10:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(EFB)
Conclusions: ∠EFB = Arc(EFB)

Step 11:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠EFB
Conclusions: ∠EFB = 2 * pi - ∠BFE

Step 12:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠ABD, ∠DBF, ∠FBA
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠ABD + ∠DBF + ∠FBA

Step 13:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : D on ⊙(F, radius_F)
Conclusions: radius_F = DF

Step 14:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠BAF, ∠CAB, ∠FAC
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠BAF + ∠CAB + ∠FAC

Step 15:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠AEF, ∠DEA, ∠FED
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠AEF + ∠DEA + ∠FED

Step 16:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on AE, ∠FAE
Conclusions: ∠FAC = ∠FAE

Step 17:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on AE, ∠AED
Conclusions: ∠AED = ∠CED

Step 18:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on AE, ∠EAB
Conclusions: ∠CAB = ∠EAB

Step 19:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : C on AE, C on BD
Conclusions: ∠ACB = ∠ECD, ∠BCA = ∠DCE

Step 20:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : CD, CE, DE
Conclusions: △CDE

Step 21:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠AED
Conclusions: ∠AED = 2 * pi - ∠DEA

Step 22:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : BF, DF, BD
Conclusions: △BDF

Step 23:
Theorem: Definition of Quadrilateral
Premises : EF, BD, BF, DE
Conclusions: Quadrilateral(B, D, E, F)

Step 24:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : AB, AF, BF
Conclusions: △ABF

Step 25:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : AF, EF, AE
Conclusions: △AEF

Step 26:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠ACB
Conclusions: ∠ACB = 2 * pi - ∠BCA

Step 27:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠ABC, ∠CBF, ∠FBA
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠ABC + ∠CBF + ∠FBA

Step 28:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : AB, AC, BC
Conclusions: △ABC

Step 29:
Theorem: Definition of Quadrilateral
Premises : AF, BF, AC, BC
Conclusions: Quadrilateral(A, C, B, F)

Step 30:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : B on ⊙(F, radius_F)
Conclusions: radius_F = BF

Step 31:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠EFA, ∠AFD, ∠DFE
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠AFD + ∠DFE + ∠EFA

Step 32:
Theorem: Circumference Split
Premises : ∠BFA, ∠EFB, ∠AFD, ∠DFE
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠AFD + ∠BFA + ∠DFE + ∠EFB

Step 33:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_F = AF, radius_F = EF
Conclusions: AF = EF

Step 34:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EFB = Arc(EFB), pi * (68 / 180) = Arc(EFB)
Conclusions: pi * (68 / 180) = ∠EFB

Step 35:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠BAF + ∠CAB + ∠FAC, ∠CAB = ∠EAB, ∠FAC = ∠FAE, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠BAF + ∠EAB + ∠FAE

Step 36:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(E, D, C)
Premises : △CDE
Conclusions: pi = ∠CED + ∠DCE + ∠EDC

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠AED = ∠CED, ∠AED = 2 * pi - ∠DEA
Conclusions: ∠CED = 2 * pi - ∠DEA

Step 38:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Quadrilateral(F, E, D, B)
Premises : Quadrilateral(B, D, E, F)
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠BFE + ∠DBF + ∠EDB + ∠FED

Step 39:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(A, E, F)
Premises : △AEF
Conclusions: pi = ∠AEF + ∠EFA + ∠FAE

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ACB = ∠ECD, ∠ACB = 2 * pi - ∠BCA
Conclusions: ∠ECD = 2 * pi - ∠BCA

Step 41:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(A, B, C)
Premises : △ABC
Conclusions: pi = ∠ABC + ∠BCA + ∠CAB

Step 42:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Quadrilateral(A, C, B, F)
Premises : Quadrilateral(A, C, B, F)
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠ACB + ∠BFA + ∠CBF + ∠FAC

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_F = AF, radius_F = BF
Conclusions: AF = BF

Step 44:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_F = DF, radius_F = BF
Conclusions: BF = DF

Step 45:
Theorem: Issoceles Triangle Property
Premises : AF = EF, △AEF
Conclusions: ∠AEF = ∠FAE

Step 46:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠AFD + ∠BFA + ∠DFE + ∠EFB, pi * (68 / 180) = ∠EFB, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = pi * (68 / 180) + ∠AFD + ∠BFA + ∠DFE

Step 47:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EFB = 2 * pi - ∠BFE, pi * (68 / 180) = ∠EFB
Conclusions: pi * (68 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠BFE

Step 48:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = ∠BAF + ∠EAB + ∠FAE, 2 * pi = ∠BAF + ∠EAB + ∠FAE
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi

Step 49:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠CED + ∠DCE + ∠EDC, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠CED + ∠DCE + ∠EDC

Step 50:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠BFE = Arc(BFE), ∠EDB = ∠EDC, 2 * pi = ∠BFE + ∠DBF + ∠EDB + ∠FED, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠DBF + ∠EDC + ∠FED + Arc(BFE)

Step 51:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠AEF + ∠EFA + ∠FAE, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠AEF + ∠EFA + ∠FAE

Step 52:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠ABC + ∠BCA + ∠CAB, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠ABC + ∠BCA + ∠CAB

Step 53:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠ABC = ∠ABD, ∠CAB = ∠EAB, 3.14 = pi, ∠BCA = ∠DCE, pi = ∠ABC + ∠BCA + ∠CAB
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠ABD + ∠DCE + ∠EAB

Step 54:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠ACB + ∠BFA + ∠CBF + ∠FAC, 3.14 = pi, ∠CBF = ∠DBF, ∠FAC = ∠FAE, ∠ACB = ∠ECD
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠BFA + ∠DBF + ∠ECD + ∠FAE

Step 55:
Theorem: Issoceles Triangle Property
Premises : △ABF, AF = BF
Conclusions: ∠BAF = ∠FBA

Step 56:
Theorem: Issoceles Triangle Property
Premises : BF = DF, △BDF
Conclusions: ∠DBF = ∠FDB

Step 57:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠AEF = ∠FAE, ∠FAC = ∠FAE
Conclusions: ∠AEF = ∠FAC

Step 58:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : pi * (68 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠BFE, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 5.1 = ∠BFE

Step 59:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = pi * (68 / 180) + ∠AFD + ∠BFA + ∠DFE, 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi
Conclusions: 2 * pi = pi * (68 / 180) + ∠AFD + ∠BFA + ∠DFE

Step 60:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi, 2 * 3.14 = ∠BFA + ∠DBF + ∠ECD + ∠FAE
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠BFA + ∠DBF + ∠ECD + ∠FAE

Step 61:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠FDB = ∠FDC, ∠DBF = ∠FDB
Conclusions: ∠DBF = ∠FDC

Step 62:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BFE = Arc(BFE), 5.1 = ∠BFE
Conclusions: 5.1 = Arc(BFE)

Step 63:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CBF = ∠DBF, ∠DBF = ∠FDC
Conclusions: ∠CBF = ∠FDC

Step 64:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 5.1 = Arc(BFE), 2 * 3.14 = ∠DBF + ∠EDC + ∠FED + Arc(BFE), ∠DBF = ∠FDC
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 5.1 + ∠EDC + ∠FDC + ∠FED

Step 65:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠BAF = ∠FBA, 3.14 = ∠ABC + ∠BCA + ∠CAB, 3.14 = ∠AEF + ∠EFA + ∠FAE, 2 * pi = ∠BAF + ∠CAB + ∠FAC, 3.14 = ∠CED + ∠DCE + ∠EDC, 2 * pi = ∠ABD + ∠DBF + ∠FBA, 2 * pi = ∠AEF + ∠DEA + ∠FED, ∠CED = 2 * pi - ∠DEA, ∠AEF = ∠FAC, 2 * pi = pi * (68 / 180) + ∠AFD + ∠BFA + ∠DFE, ∠CAB = ∠EAB, ∠CBF = ∠FDC, 2 * pi = ∠ABC + ∠CBF + ∠FBA, 2 * pi = ∠AFD + ∠DFE + ∠EFA, 2 * pi = ∠BFA + ∠DBF + ∠ECD + ∠FAE, pi = ∠CED + ∠DCE + ∠EDC, ∠ECD = 2 * pi - ∠BCA, 3.14 = ∠ABD + ∠DCE + ∠EAB, 2 * 3.14 = 5.1 + ∠EDC + ∠FDC + ∠FED
Conclusions: 0.59 = ∠CAB
